alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Heavy rain and wind will impact portions of northwestern Catoosa, western Walker and Dade Counties through 115 PM EST... At 1244 PM EST, a line of heavy showers extended from near Signal Mountain to near Cloudland Canyon State Park to Powell, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, Rising Fawn, Noble, Indian Springs, Graysville, Blue Spring, Wildwood, Fairview, Boynton, Beaumont, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
